body: After spitting at his victim's police colleagues, a Brooklyn man was sentenced yesterday to 23 years to life for fatally shooting his estranged wife, a New York City police officer. The man, John Rivera, 38, was sentenced in State Supreme Court in Brooklyn in a courtroom packed with relatives and colleagues of the victim, Kimberly Rivera. She was
title: METRO NEWS BRIEFS: NEW YORK; Man Gets 23 Years to Life For Killing Officer-Wife

body: An unemployed city bus driver charged with fatally shooting his estranged wife, a police officer, in January was convicted yesterday by a Brooklyn jury. The defendant, John Rivera, 37, was convicted of second-degree murder with depraved indifference for human life in the shooting of Officer Kimberly Rivera, 28, during an argument outside his
title: Man Convicted of Killing His Wife, a Police Officer

body: Adam Odetalla was putting the watering hose away in his backyard in Brooklyn when he saw the thing. It was half hidden under the round plastic baby pool, a menacing dark-green presence with beady eyes and razor-sharp teeth. Suddenly, it lunged and snapped at him. ''Alligator! Alligator! Go back!'' he shouted at his sister, Diana, 14, brother,
title: Alligator Is Found (In Yard, Not Sewer)

body: Louis Liotta, a respected photographer who worked at The New York Post for half a century, died on Friday at Lutheran Medical Center in Brooklyn. He was 76 and lived in Bath Beach, Brooklyn, where he was born. The cause was kidney failure, his newspaper colleagues said. Mr. Liotta, who was still a staff photographer at The Post at his death, had
title: Louis Liotta, a New York Post Photographer, 76

body: For a decade, city officials have boasted that nearly three-quarters of New York's streets were acceptably clean. In February, Mayor Rudolph W. Giuliani released the city's latest self-evaluation, a survey that said 83 percent of the streets were clean -- a remarkable figure considering substantial cuts in the Sanitation Department's budget in
title: A Review Finds the City Dirtier Than It Says It Is
